title: The Confessions of Nat Turner: And Related Documents
description: Careful study of the Nat Turner slave rebellion of 1831 reveals much about master, slaves, and the relationship between them in the antebellum South. The central document in this volume  Nat Turner's confession follwing the rebellion in Virginia  is supported by newspaper articles, trial transcripts, and excerpts from the diary of Virginia governor John Floyd.
author: Kenneth S. Greenberg
